page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT - NORTH PEMBROKE
page.content: H.M.Dockyard was the was the main reason for the growth of Pembroke and the building of Pembroke Dock and since the Dockyard closed in the 1920s,there has always been high unemployment in the town. In recent years,up to one third of the men in the town have been out of work.The building of oil refineries and a power station have helped provide jobs, as has the opening of the B&I Ferry Terminal at Pembroke Dock, but the area still has many problems. Several factories in the area have closed down lately, though people hope that the new enterprise zone will bring jobs to the area. Of 17 children interviewed in the area, 3 had fathers who worked on the refineries,2 worked in the Dockyard,1 was a farmer and 7 had other jobs. 10 children had mothers with jobs.
